ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to craft an argument, structure different english papers, edit and revise an essay

I hadn't taken a lot of English courses previously, so I wouldn't say I had the best skills going into the class, but Sophie made it a great class regardless of what level of experience anyone had coming in and was very helpful and clear about how we could craft a good analytical essay.
I learned to write more coherently and synthesize information in a more effective manner.

- research
- close reading analysis
- argumentative writing
I truly developed my writing skills. I now feel confident to brainstorm, research, write, edit, and polish a piece of writing.
It helped me become a better writer. I feel like by the end of the course, I was a way more competent writer

This course presented a unique opportunity to learn about both the strengths and fallacies of the beauty industry. Critically examined the dynamic nature of societal aesthetic conventions through various media/perspectives (modern articles, philosophy, advertisements, social media, artwork). Class structure was highly interactive, allowing students to incorporate their own experiences to enrich class discussions.
I learned how to form my own opinions on academic discourse, how to take in loads of research and media and form it into my own thoughts and opinions and how to talk about beauty in an objective way

In this course, I gained a comprehensive understanding of the beauty dilemma through cultural, social, and historical lenses. I learned to construct compelling novel arguments for essays and greatly improved my analytical and critical thinking skills. This course also helped me improve my sentence structure, fluency, and organizational skills, resulting in a refinement of my writing abilities. Overall, this course was instrumental in strengthening my writing skills and providing me with the tools and resources to express my thoughts precisely and effectively.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths -- professor is always available to help, assignments are well thought out and make you think, readings are interesting 

Weakness -- sometimes it felt like the class time itself wasn't super helpful, not all of the reading applied to essays, so class time felt a little unessecary sometimes
The material was particularly engaging, the teacher was super flexible about all assignments and I ended up writing an amazing final essay that showed how much I had learned
Amazing class!

I really enjoyed the seminar time --- while we tended to have a general direction in the conversation, there was a lot of time to bring up interesting ideas or focus on a small detail of whatever topic we were discussing which made for very interesting discussions and a comfortable environment for everyone to share. I also really appreciated the time Sophie took to focus on a specific writing tool/structure when we were working on our papers.
This course in its structure was great with encouraging class engagement and self improvement.

- strengths: touched on broad important topics on beauty trends and sexuality, which was educational. 
- weaknesses: could have focused more on beauty trends in other countries like Asia and Africa

Strengths: Amazing Teacher who truly facilitated an encouraging learning environment. Ton of freedom with prompts (People wrote about fashion, beauty products, celebrities etc.). Fun discussions.

Weaknesses: Some of the readings are a bit dense, though that was only for the first 2-3 weeks of class.

Strengths: engaging/interactive course (allowed for improvement conveying ideas in both written and verbal formats), critical examination of societal beauty standards often overlooked in other classes/contexts, diverse curriculum (virtue of beauty, close-reading advertisements, plastic-surgery, body dysmorphia, etc.), research paper allowed for creative freedom to apply class topics to any subject of interest, extensive/thoughtful feedback on writing assignments.
Areas for Improvement: overall, class curriculum was broad and facilitated student learning. In the future, I would love to have more discussions on different perspectives of beauty among different cultures.

Strengths: class discussion, professor engagement, homework load, readings
Weaknesses: None

The structure of this course was excellent for facilitating student learning. The in-class discussions and activities were engaging and encouraged in-depth thought and reflection on the pieces assigned for homework. The teacher provided extensive, useful feedback on the essays and was always available to help which greatly improved my writing skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend to any freshman looking to strengthened writing skills. The more you engage with the course and go to office hours the more you will get out of it.
YESSS! Best english class I have taken at Yale
Yes! Amazing material covered and really interesting

Yes! As someone who hasn't had a lot of writing experience, it was extremely helpful for me to take an intro-level class where I received really great feedback about my work. I was in office hours a good amount, and the conversations I had with Sophie about my writing style, the structure of my essays, dissecting particular paragraphs, etc., was the most feedback I'd ever gotten on my writing. Also, I really enjoyed the topic of this class and the way the curriculum was structured to hit a lot of different aspects of the topic (e.g. historical beauty standards, plastic surgery, men vs. women, representation in art, etc.) because it helped me feel like I got a very holistic overview of "beautiful people." Additionally, as a very dedicated STEM major, I'm generally less excited about English/humanities requirements but I was always happy to attend class and, if anything, this class really demonstrated the value of distributional requirements.
Yes, this course is both engaging and helpful.
Yes, it teaches you the fundamental basics of writing
Yes! Yes! Yes! A stress-free way to truly improve your writing skills and learn about a relevant topic.
Yes, I would

I would HIGHLY recommend this course to any student regardless of their academic background or interests. It is a wonderful opportunity to ponder and explain the beauty industry and societal stereotypes. The content is highly applicable to student-life and provides unique insight into our interactions with aesthetic conventions  it is also fun and quirky (we examined Calvin-Klein underwear advertisements, makeup palettes, and Beyonc music videos)!
YES 100%
Yes, I would highly recommend this course to another student.
